title: Ajay Devgn as Vijay Salgoankar in 'Drishyam'— framed or guilty?
text:
"Main toh sirf ek chauthi paas aam aadmi hoon...", Vijay Salgaonkar's world is his family — his wife Nandini (Shriya Saran) and his two daughters Anju (Ishita Dutta) and Anu (Mrinal Jadhav). But his peaceful life, as he knows it, ceases to exist when IG Meera Deshmukh's (Tabu) son, Sameer (Rishab Chaddha) goes missing.
She is a senior, tough as nails officer backed by the system and the entire police force. And above all, she is a mother. All her instincts suggest that Vijay Salgaonkar and his family are hiding something, yet she has no evidence that can prove her theory.
READ: Ajay Devgn about Drishyam: The film is relatable
And what is your theory? Read on to decide whether Vijay is being framed or he is guilty.
Sameer Deshmukh (Rishab Chaddha)
Meera Deshmukh knows that her son is in trouble. Moreover, when the last time his phone was on, it was traced back to the area around which the Salgaonkars live.
On his part, Vijay maintains that he wasn't home or even in town on the said day.
Sub-Inspector Gaitonde (Kamlesh Sawant)
However, Sub-Inspector Gaitonde (Kamlesh Sawant) vouches that it was Vijay whom he saw driving away in a yellow car — the same one that Sameer drives.
Anu (Mrinal)
When interrogated, all the members of the Salgaonkar family, including their younger daughter Anu, testify that they were in Panjim on the day Sameer Deshmukh went missing.
Martin (Sharad Bhutaria)
'Vijay is an honest and honourable man who could never be involved in any such case.' Not only Martin (Sharad Bhutaria), all the neighbours in the small town believe that he is innocent and that he is being framed.
IG Meera Deshmukh (Tabu)
All proof and all the witnesses stand with Vijay and support his testimony. But Meera still believes that he is lying.
To find out more, watch Drishyam at a theatre close to you. Drishyam , produced by Viacom18 Motion Pictures and Panorama Studios, releases July 31, 2015.
